answers.text: Morocco, western Algeria, and the Spanish cities Ceuta and Melilla

qas.question: During what period did Mauretania exist?
Where were the people of the region noted?

context: <a1_0>The Romans<a1_0/> interacted with and later conquered parts of Mauretania, an early state that covered modern <a0_0>Morocco, western Algeria, and the Spanish cities Ceuta and Melilla<a0_0/> during <a2_0>the classical period.<a2_0/> The people of the region were noted <a3_0>in Classical literature<a3_0/> as Mauri, which was subsequently rendered as <a4_0>Moors<a4_0/> in English.
